pageContent: Introduction: Controversy persists about whether men should be screened for prostate cancer. On the other hand, the benefit of colorectal cancer screening has been proven for men starting at age 50. We aimed to examine the rate of exposure to previous screening tests for prostate cancer and colorectal cancer in a cohort of men living in Quebec.

metaData.source:
Prostate Cancer in Men With Treated Advanced Heart Failure: Should we Keep Screening?
